content.label: Excellent rogue-like / chess hybrid. My favorite game in the App Store.

title.label: Great strategy, good for start/stop playing

content.label: Fun just like 868-HACK
This is an excellent little game with a great deal of depth. The learning curve is a bit steep, but the game is very fair in its difficulty. Well worth taking some time to learn the ropes.

title.label: Great game, well worth the price

content.label: I can't stop playing. The depth is really good once you are familiar with the move patterns of everyone

title.label: Hated it, learned it, Love it!

content.label: A great game that requires the quick tutorial provided, don't skip it! Once you learn the mechanics the game is an awesome challenge. I just wish there was more of a quest mode with more rewards as you progress, unlockables. I hate most games these days, this one is a gem. Get it.

A simple but fun game.  Innovative.  The rules are easy but it gradually becomes harder level by level sucking you in.  Fun mechanics.  Short games are easy to play multiple times in one setting.  Achievements give you some longer term goals.  More of a strategy game than everything, this is not a simulation or a role playing game.  Highly recommended.

Why does a new version delete my high scores!?

Otherwise a great (and addictive) game.
This game is a simple yet challenging surprise.  It is well worth the money and offers an interesting version of a turn-based combat game.  It plays well on both iPad and iPhone.

Love this game. Everytime you lose, you know it's your own fault. The game is never unfair. Plus no in-app purchases, which is fantastic. 

My only feedback is to go back to the harder daily challenges, or at least make them available too! So much more fun than these new easier ones.

title.label: Best iPhone game I've ever played

content.label: Period
Perfect, combat-centric roguelike that's short enough to play in bursts but with enough long term challenges to keep you coming back

Simple yet very deep. At first glance it doesn't seem very good at all. However, don't be fooled by the old graphics or the board game like movement of your enemies. This game is very well done. Multiple approaches are available to how you want to develop the hero to tackle each level. When you advance, there is an earned feeling of accomplishment. Definitely worth the download. 

My only complaint is a lack of appropriate explanation of the game, I had to get the details of the game from a website before I understood everything.

title.label: A lot of repetitive fun but not worth $3.00

content.label: This IS a fun game but I really don't get all the 5 star reviews, is there something I'm missing here? Getting to lvl 16 is relatively easy once you figure the game out however going past lvl 16 is pointless as you're unable to heal & there are no further objectives. If you access an alter but don't want anything there's no option to back out meaning you have to choose something even though the choices given may be counterproductive. The challenge mode is OK but eh.... Quest For The Fleece aka: spend 30 min making it to lvl 16 then either go further until you die or port to the surface and game over....
Well balanced gameplay.  Great for quick pickup games.  Overall, one of my favs, highly recommended.

This is one of those games you end up always cherishing. Especially in an App Store where gameplay crippled, pay to win, ad ridden apps, reign supreme. It is extremely fun, and with this new update I will be playing this game for a very very long time... Or at least until I rage quit because of my own stupid mistakes.

When I first saw this app, I was shocked—I had never seen an app with five stars. I looked down the reviews and saw only five stars. Needless to say I bought the game immediately. The game is great, and I know it looks like one of those games that is either really good or really bad; trust me, it's not very good— it's amazing. You have to think every move (it's like a board game, almost, but better.) There are in game upgrades, and none of them are too OP. The two biggest complaints I saw— not expansive enough, and annoying controls. First off, the controls are very accurate. I've had trouble with tapping the wrong space too, but come on, that only happens when you are tapping too fast and not thinking, which is a bad idea anyway, considering the game's need for slow, deep thinking. Second, there is a new mode called "challenge mode" in the newest update, and probably more modes in the future. And if a game like this is too expansive, it gets stupid anyway— look what happened to Pixel Gun. In short— perfect, beautiful strategy game – but think or else. Now excuse me while I go play a round our two. Level 17 scares me...

title.label: One of my favorite iOS games

content.label: This game is awesome! It is very easy to pick up yet has challenging puzzle gameplay. The controls are simple but intuitive and responsive. The random generated levels, different ability combinations, and high score tracker give this game a ton of replayability. The new challenge mode gives the game even more longevity and provides even more difficulty to an already challenging game. This is a must-have game in my book.
you go.
Don't let the unfamiliar name or simple graphics fool you, this is a fun game with hours and hours of engaging gameplay.
Love it! Can't put this down. Tremendous replay value with a ton of little quirks that enhance tactical decisions as you unlock and discover them. Buy it.

It is by far the one of the best strategy titles available on iOS , toped only by FTL. Its easy too pick up and play a short session, or play for hours. It's very well designed, And I cant wait for a free content update, or even DLC. Keep up the good work.

This game has great replayability and is a good balance of strategy and fun. Just wish that once you actually get the fleece on LV16, they gave you a new objective! I got the fleece, and then!... Back to level one to do it again. Please keep the gameplay as is, just add more objectives and levels. Love this game.

title.label: Very Cool but had a flaw

content.label:
Game is great, been having fun with it and is not my main game.

Only issue is that at times I can't predict if I'll stab or lunge or I'll just land on the spot and get hit by the footman. Don't know why I don't stab or lunge when the move calls for it.

Still a great game!

The one complaint I have is that even though this game is what I was looking for in a turn based strategy - it does not really offer much for the price. I wish there were more enemies, different quests and maybe a second mode.  There are other games that are only 99 cents that offer that!
Best iOS game! Very addictive and highly strategic.

title.label: Why is this game so good?

content.label: I didn't buy this right away, for some reason I was unsure about it. Then I bought it and wished I had bought it way sooner. Great game, one of the best I've ever downloaded. Buy it.
Simple game with a good amount of strategy. Not too complicated, so it is fun to play with a couple minutes of down time.
Just amazing a great strategy game
App opens, starts game, and every time the "welcome back" message appears it exits the app.
Total radness. Elegant design, addictive fun. Top marks.

You are browsing the App Store and see game after game that claims to be 'free', but drives you crazy with IAPs and social media requests. Worse, you buy a game thinking you will now own it, but uh oh! The expansion is extra! Not this. You pay once for a cute, engaging game and are never bothered about linking to Facebook or paying for bonuses. Simple and fun.
So simple you can learn it in a couple minutes. So subtle you'll play it over and over.

title.label: Great Game! Could Use Some More Gameplay

content.label: Amazing game! I think more game modes and prayers should be available to amp up the strategy even further!!
A super minimal roguelike with deceptively complex strategy mechanics. One of my favorite games in a while.
Very unique and clever. I enjoyed it so much. I didn't expect this much when I saw the game screenshots, but after playing it I realized how awesome it is. Very recommended!
Simple to learn. Difficult to master. Polished to a t. Worth every penny.
This a great game that is easy to learn and very fun to play. I really like the press-your-luck aspect of the game later on when deciding whether to go to deeper level or to cash out

I am increasingly addicted to this game.  It is deceptively deep in strategic contemplation as choices made early have profound consequences for later gameplay.

The music really sets the mood and makes the experience immersive.

I stand by my earlier comments, and would like having different dungeons available which have different characteristics which are perhaps only available once certain abilities are unlocked.  

-- Original

I am really enjoying this game.  I'd like for it to be more in-depth.  Some ideas:
- persistent Rpg elements like character development
- multiple quests
- rare items

Very good casual strategy without IAP; I'm on board

This is a pure experience that is so rare on the AppStore. The game is uncluttered; there are no daily challenges, overbearing social media integration, or annoying IAP. This game introduces some very simple rules that make the player very powerful but punishes you dearly for mistakes (usually if you're not thinking through your decisions).
Because it is so good that you'll end spending days getting that fleece! This game rocks. The AI is smart and beatable as long as you can outsmart it.

CRASHES EVERYTIME I TRY TO PLAY.
If this was a free game i wouldnt mind but i paid for this. Dont get it it just crashes.

Hoplite is a little bit like playing chess with one piece that you're able to upgrade slowly over the course of the game. The game balance is incredible - there are many different upgrades, and all of them are useful if you learn a good play styles to go with them. I've won a couple times now and keep playing because I enjoy challenging myself by trying out different builds that I haven't succeeded with yet. This has definitely been one of my most played games lately.
Just wish it were longer

Just the right level of depth and complexity while being easy to pick up. Great mix of tactics and roguelike elements. Best of all no obnoxious in-app purchases, you get the whole game for $2. Really fun game!

I've got to say, I wasn't expecting much but it turned out to be very very addictive and fun. I think that 4 stars are fare because it could use a little touching up and some new characters. Other than that I think it's a great game.
Fun, perfect for playing for a bit or hours. Spent 3 hours at it yesterday without noticing.

Not the epic that the 5-star reviews make it out to be. A competent little puzzler with randomly generated levels that is mildly compelling IMO. I got tired of it after 1/2 hour and don't think I'll be back to it. 

It really needs an almanac explaining what all the different enemies are and all the different powers you can use. Otherwise it's a lot of trial and error.

Not my thing but might be yours. Give it a try if on sale.

This game is one of the best I've played on the iPhone. It has kept me hooked for hours with its great strategy and achievements. The power up system is awesome, and the variety of power ups allows you to try different strategies game after game. It has great replay value, because after you beat it (level 16) you can play again and again to see how deep you can go. I would love to see more quests with more achievements added, and would gladly pay for them!

This game just keeps getting better. I really like that the game feels hard to begin with and then those parts get easier and the game is still challenging. This is the first game I've played that unlocks upgrades in a way that adds to the game. I really like that throwing, bashing, and leaping are all workable strategies that play very differently. Very very well done.
